intro: Roettlera conicapsularis, commonly known as the cone-capsule roettlera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that remains attached to the stem, giving it the common name. Roettlera conicapsularis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
